name: Hoppip
flavorText: This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Skiploom
flavorText: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon's head.
Ability1Text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Jumpluff
flavorText: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.
Ability1Text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Pineco
flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

name: Forretress ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 Basic Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Heracross
flavorText: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Tropius
flavorText: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Combee
flavorText: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Vespiquen
flavorText: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your Benched Combee and shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck. If you can't shuffle a Combee into your deck, this attack does nothing.

name: Snover
flavorText: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.

name: Abomasnow
flavorText: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
Ability1Text: Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.

name: Sprigatito
flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Sprigatito
flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

name: Floragato
flavorText: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
Attack2Text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Meowscarada ex
Ability1Text: You must discard a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Tarountula
flavorText: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

name: Tarountula
flavorText: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.

name: Spidops
flavorText: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
Attack1Text: Shuffle each player's Active Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck. (You choose a new Active Pokémon first.)

name: Nymble
flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Nymble
flavorText: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Lokix
flavorText: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon evolved from Nymble during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Bramblin
flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Bramblin
flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Brambleghast
flavorText: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks that the Defending Pokémon uses cost ColorlessColorless more.

name: Rellor
flavorText: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

name: Rellor
flavorText: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

name: Wo-Chien ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Fletchinder
flavorText: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Talonflame
flavorText: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Litleo
flavorText: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
Attack1Text: Discard a Stadium in play.

name: Pyroar
flavorText: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It's thanks to them that their pride doesn't starve.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Oricorio
flavorText: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Evolution Pokémon.

name: Fuecoco
flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

name: Fuecoco
flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Crocalor
flavorText: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.

name: Skeledirge ex
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

name: Chi-Yu ex
Attack1Text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Choose up to 3 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Magikarp
flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Gyarados
flavorText: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
Attack1Text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 100 more damage.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

name: Marill
flavorText: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Azumarill
flavorText: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

name: Delibird
flavorText: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Luvdisc
flavorText: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Supporter cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Eiscue
flavorText: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Quaxly
flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Quaxly
flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Quaxwell
flavorText: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

name: Quaquaval ex
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Put 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

name: Cetoddle
flavorText: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cetoddle
flavorText: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon is now Asleep. Heal 60 damage from it.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Cetitan
flavorText: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 140 more damage.

name: Veluza
flavorText: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
Attack2Text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack can be used for Water.

name: Frigibax
flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

name: Frigibax
flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

name: Arctibax
flavorText: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

name: Baxcalibur
flavorText: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Chien-Pao ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: You may discard any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Pikachu ex
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
Attack1Text: Attach up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

name: Electrode
flavorText: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Shinx
flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

name: Luxray
flavorText: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in your hand and you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, you may put this Pokémon onto your Bench.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Pincurchin
flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Pincurchin
flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: You can use this attack only if this Pokémon used Stun Needle during your last turn.

name: Pawmi
flavorText: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

name: Pawmo
flavorText: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Pawmot
flavorText: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Tadbulb
flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Tadbulb
flavorText: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

name: Bellibolt ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: You may discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon to make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

name: Wattrel
flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

name: Wattrel
flavorText: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
Attack1Text: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.

name: Kilowattrel
flavorText: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Therapeutic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. If tails, discard a card from your hand.

name: Slowking ex
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Mismagius
flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

name: Spiritomb
flavorText: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
Ability1Text: Basic Pokémon V in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.
Attack1Text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

name: Gothita
flavorText: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Gothorita
flavorText: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Gothitelle
flavorText: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe's end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck and put 1 of them back. Put the other card on the bottom of their deck.
Attack1Text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

name: Dedenne ex
Attack1Text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Oranguru
flavorText: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else— like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

name: Palossand
flavorText: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
Attack2Text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Mimikyu
flavorText: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon ex and Pokémon V.
Attack1Text: Put 7 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Ceruledge
flavorText: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Rabsca
flavorText: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
Attack1Text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Tinkatink
flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Tinkatink
flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
Attack1Text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Tinkatink
flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Tinkatuff
flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Tinkatuff
flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Tinkaton
flavorText: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
Ability1Text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Mankey
flavorText: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

name: Primeape
flavorText: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Pupitar
flavorText: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.

name: Makuhita
flavorText: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.

name: Hariyama
flavorText: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.
Ability1Text: All of your Pokémon take 10 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Croagunk
flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Toxicroak
flavorText: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Rockruff
flavorText: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.

name: Lycanroc ex
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Passimian
flavorText: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won't obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Falinks
flavorText: The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.
Attack2Text: If Falinks is on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Nacli
flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

name: Nacli
flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Naclstack
flavorText: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

name: Garganacl
flavorText: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
Ability1Text: During Pokémon Checkup, heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Glimmet
flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Glimmet
flavorText: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

name: Glimmora
flavorText: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
Ability1Text: When this Pokémon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 6 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

name: Ting-Lu ex
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play that have any damage counters on them have no Abilities, except for Pokémon ex.
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Paldean Wooper
flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Paldean Wooper
flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.

name: Paldean Clodsire ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

name: Honchkrow
flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.
Attack2Text: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't, this attack does nothing.

name: Sneasel
flavorText: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.

name: Weavile
flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon to the Active Spot.

name: Tyranitar
flavorText: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

name: Sableye
flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Seviper
flavorText: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Deino
flavorText: It can't see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Zweilous
flavorText: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don't give each head the same amount of attention, they'll begin fighting out of jealousy.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Hydreigon
flavorText: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Discard the other cards.

name: Maschiff
flavorText: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Maschiff
flavorText: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.

name: Mabosstiff
flavorText: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

name: Shroodle
flavorText: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
Attack1Text: Put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Shroodle
flavorText: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Grafaiai
flavorText: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: You may discard as many Basic Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each type of Basic Energy you discarded in this way.

name: Bombirdier
flavorText: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon's chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Corviknight
flavorText: Corviknight can't serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokémon's natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Cufant
flavorText: Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.

name: Copperajah ex
Ability1Text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Orthworm
flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon has 3 or more Metal Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Noibat
flavorText: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.

name: Noivern ex
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Special Energy or Stadium cards from their hand.

name: Girafarig
flavorText: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Farigiraf
flavorText: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
Attack1Text: Choose a player. That player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.

name: Dunsparce
flavorText: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dudunsparce
flavorText: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Wingull
flavorText: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.

name: Pelipper
flavorText: It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may choose 1: put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand; or search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, put it into your hand, and then shuffle your deck.

name: Slakoth
flavorText: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Vigoroth
flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Slaking
flavorText: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon is Asleep, flip 2 coins instead of 1 during Pokémon Checkup. If either of them is tails, this Pokémon is still Asleep.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Fletchling
flavorText: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Rookidee
flavorText: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee's eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Corvisquire
flavorText: It's said that the reason behind Corvisquire's high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokémon.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

name: Tandemaus
flavorText: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Tandemaus
flavorText: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

name: Maushold
flavorText: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.
Attack2Text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon for each of your Maushold in play.

name: Squawkabilly ex
Ability1Text: Once during your first turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Squawk and Seize Ability during your turn.
Attack1Text: Attach up to 2 Basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Flamigo
flavorText: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Flamigo, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

name: Heracross
flavorText: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Tropius
flavorText: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Sprigatito
flavorText: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Floragato
flavorText: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
Attack2Text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Bramblin
flavorText: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Fletchinder
flavorText: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Pyroar
flavorText: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It's thanks to them that their pride doesn't starve.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Attack2Text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Fuecoco
flavorText: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Crocalor
flavorText: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.

name: Magikarp
flavorText: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Marill
flavorText: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Eiscue
flavorText: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Quaxly
flavorText: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

name: Quaxwell
flavorText: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

name: Frigibax
flavorText: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

name: Arctibax
flavorText: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

name: Baxcalibur
flavorText: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Basic Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Raichu
flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Mismagius
flavorText: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

name: Gothorita
flavorText: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Sandygast
flavorText: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else— like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.

name: Rabsca
flavorText: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
Attack1Text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Tinkatink
flavorText: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
Attack1Text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Tinkatuff
flavorText: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Paldean Tauros
flavorText: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Nacli
flavorText: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Paldean Wooper
flavorText: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Tyranitar
flavorText: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck.

name: Grafaiai
flavorText: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: You may discard as many Basic Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each type of Basic Energy you discarded in this way.

name: Orthworm
flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
Ability1Text: If this Pokémon has 3 or more Metal Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.
Attack1Text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Rookidee
flavorText: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee's eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Maushold
flavorText: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.
Attack2Text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon for each of your Maushold in play.

flavorText: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Flamigo, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the United Wings attack.

name: Farigiraf
flavorText: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
Attack1Text: Choose a player. That player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.

name: Dudunsparce
flavorText: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

name: Forretress ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 5 Basic Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Meowscarada ex
Ability1Text: You must discard a Basic Grass Energy card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Wo-Chien ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Skeledirge ex
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Chi-Yu ex
Attack1Text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.
Attack2Text: Choose up to 3 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Basic Fire Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Quaquaval ex
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Put 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

name: Chien-Pao ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: You may discard any amount of Water Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Bellibolt ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: You may discard 2 Lightning Energy from this Pokémon to make your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed.

name: Slowking ex
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Dedenne ex
Attack1Text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Tinkaton ex
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage for each card in your hand.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Lycanroc ex
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put 10 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Annihilape ex
Attack1Text: Put up to 12 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

name: Ting-Lu ex
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Pokémon in play that have any damage counters on them have no Abilities, except for Pokémon ex.
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Paldean Clodsire ex
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, if a Stadium is in play, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Poisoned.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, during your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

Attack1Text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

Attack2Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.
